thread.title: Prince Harry tries to play classic prank on schoolboy and totally fails in sweet exchange caught on camera
thread.title_full: Prince Harry tries to play classic prank on schoolboy and totally fails in sweet exchange caught on camera

author: Nicola Oakley
title: Prince Harry tries to play classic prank on schoolboy and totally fails in sweet exchange caught on camera
text:
Prince Harry tries to play classic prank on schoolboy and totally fails in sweet exchange caught on camera Like a true gent, Harry then pretended to fall for the retaliation Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Prince Harry tries prank on schoolboy and totally fails Share this video   Thank you for subscribing!   
Imagine sitting next to Prince Harry and trying to look like you're not bothered by it at all. 
A young lad managed to nail the 'keeping it cool' look yesterday while Harry was visiting his school in Nottingham - even when the prince decided to play a little prank on him. 
Harry, being a bit of a joker, tried to do the old 'wrong shoulder' prank and tapped the boy on his right-hand side. 
Of course, he didn't fall for it and looked straight at the prince on his left, totally unimpressed. 
Come on, Harry, that's such an old one! Prince Harry was visiting youth projects at Nottingham Academy (Photo: PA) 
Luckily the cameras were rolling at the school and the sweet moment was caught on camera. 
Women everywhere will probably be swooning watching the video as it then becomes an adorable little game between the two. 
Having fallen for the trick, the pupil decided to do it back to him (and, of course, like the true chivalrous gent he is, 32-year-old Harry pretended to fall for it). (Photo: PA) 
Never change, Harry. Never change. 
The prince was visiting Nottingham Academy to see the work of two youth projects, joining in a Full Effect music and sports session with the kids, listening to rap music and watching dances. 
Today he is doing work to champion mental health projects as part of the #HeadsTogether and #TimeToTalk campaigns. Like us on Facebook
